channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache OpenMeetings
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache OpenMeetings

item.title: CVE-2018-1286|2024-08-05T03:59:37.608Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: In Apache OpenMeetings 3.0.0 - 4.0.1, CRUD operations on privileged users are not password protected allowing an authenticated attacker to deny service for privileged users.

item.title: CVE-2017-7666|2024-08-05T16:12:27.831Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks, XSS attacks, click-jacking, and MIME based attacks.

item.title: CVE-2017-7681|2024-08-05T16:12:27.928Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 is vulnerable to SQL injection. This allows authenticated users to modify the structure of the existing query and leak the structure of other queries being made by the application in the back-end.

item.title: CVE-2017-7682|2024-08-05T16:12:27.934Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 3.2.0 is vulnerable to parameter manipulation attacks, as a result attacker has access to restricted areas.

item.title: CVE-2017-7685|2024-08-05T16:12:27.873Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 responds to the following insecure HTTP methods: PUT, DELETE, HEAD, and PATCH.

item.title: CVE-2017-7664|2024-08-05T16:12:28.233Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Uploaded XML documents were not correctly validated in Apache OpenMeetings 3.1.0.

item.title: CVE-2017-7688|2024-08-05T16:12:27.837Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 updates user password in insecure manner.

item.title: CVE-2017-7673|2024-08-05T16:12:27.911Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 uses not very strong cryptographic storage, captcha is not used in registration and forget password dialogs and auth forms missing brute force protection.

item.title: CVE-2017-7683|2024-08-05T16:12:27.821Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 displays Tomcat version and detailed error stack trace, which is not secure.

item.title: CVE-2017-7684|2024-08-05T16:12:28.182Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 doesn't check contents of files being uploaded. An attacker can cause a denial of service by uploading multiple large files to the server.

item.title: CVE-2017-7680|2024-08-05T16:12:27.837Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Apache OpenMeetings 1.0.0 has an overly permissive crossdomain.xml file. This allows for flash content to be loaded from untrusted domains.

item.title: CVE-2017-7663|2024-08-05T16:12:27.768Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20openmeetings
item.description: Both global and Room chat are vulnerable to XSS attack in Apache OpenMeetings 3.2.0.
